div.p: Greetings. Reverend Father in Christ, these are now handed to me at night by Italian men who come from Chiavenna and pass through here to Geneva; therefore, I barely skimmed through a few lines, and I am sending everything as it was given to me.

Whether the book has reached your hands before or not, I still think it is necessary to write to the illustrious man Martinengo; there are many reasons, which I do not add here; you, with your wisdom, understand them well enough.
In the Adige region, the plague has begun to spread quite significantly, as well as in several places beyond the Steig; I believe it will bring an end to the council.
Farewell, reverend Father in Christ, with all your people. August 19, in the year 1563, in the evening.
We are expecting news from you about England and France. To the most esteemed Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his lord and reverend Father in Christ.
